intro: Myrsine molokaiensis, commonly known as Molokaʻi myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is a shrub with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Myrsine molokaiensis is of conservation interest due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
